Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for creating, and keeping track of all X's and O's on the playing board. The class is also responsible for checking for valid moves.
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String[][] currentBoard
      2D string array which holds X's and O's
      private java.lang.String O
      String representation of an "O" Placed in the currentBoard array whenever player 2 makes a move
      private java.lang.String winnersName
      String that will contain the name of the winner (either "player 1" or "player 2")
      private java.lang.String X
      String representation of an "X" placed whenever player one makes a move

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Class constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkForWinner()
      Checks if any win conditions are met.
      boolean checkIfValid(int xCord, int yCord)
      Determines off of the x-coordinate and y-coordinate whether a move is valid (an invalid move is a move that has either already been made, or that isn't within the playing board).
      void printBoard()
      Prints the current board, with both X's and O's
      void setO(int xCord, int yCord)
      Called whenever player 2 makes a move.
      void setX(int xCord, int yCord)
      Called whenever player 1 makes a move.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • currentBoard

        private java.lang.String[][] currentBoard
        2D string array which holds X's and O's

      • X

        private final java.lang.String X
        String representation of an "X" placed whenever player one makes a move
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • O

        private final java.lang.String O
        String representation of an "O" Placed in the currentBoard array whenever player 2 makes a move
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • winnersName

        private java.lang.String winnersName
        String that will contain the name of the winner (either "player 1" or "player 2")

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Class constructor. Responsible for defining the currentBoard as a 3x3 array and setting each square with it's default value "-"

    • Method Detail

      • setX

        public void setX(int xCord,
                 int yCord)
        Called whenever player 1 makes a move. Sets the selected x and y coordinate with an X. Checks for a winner whenever called
        Parameters:
        xCord - x-coordinate on the playing board to set to an X
        yCord - y-coordinate on the playing board to set to a Y

      • setO

        public void setO(int xCord,
                 int yCord)
        Called whenever player 2 makes a move. Sets the selected x and y coordinate with an O. Checks for a winner whenever called.
        Parameters:
        xCord - x-coordinate on the playing board to set to an O
        yCord - y-coordinate on the playing board to set to a O

      • checkIfValid

        public boolean checkIfValid(int xCord,
                            int yCord)
        Determines off of the x-coordinate and y-coordinate whether a move is valid (an invalid move is a move that has either already been made, or that isn't within the playing board).
        Parameters:
        xCord - x-coordinate to check
        yCord - y-coordinate to check
        Returns:
        boolean valid as true when the move is valid

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Prints the current board, with both X's and O's

      • checkForWinner

        public boolean checkForWinner()
        Checks if any win conditions are met. If any are, that player (player 1 for "x"s, player 2 for "o"s is the winner
        Returns:
        boolean winner, returns true when a winner is found.
